title: Beechcraft - King Air B200
desc: The King Air B200 is generally used for business travel, express freight divery, air ambulance services, and various goverment and military missions, due to its versatility, ability to operate on shorter runways, and preformance in diverse conditions.

title: Bell Textron - Bell 407
desc: The Bell 407 is a versatile utility helicopter commonly used for corporate and offshore transport, air ambulance services, law enforcment, electronic news gathering, and flimmaking.

title: Jabiru Aircraft Pty Ltd - Jabiru J430
desc: The Jabiru J430 is generally used as a four-seat light touring aircraft, often provided in kit form. It's popular for recreational flying, flight training, rural property managment, commuting, surveillance, and surveying, particularly in some African countries for anti-poaching and wildlife conservation.

title: Robinson Helicopter Company - R44 Raven II
desc: The Robinson R44 is a versatile four-seat helicopter primarily used for pilot training, scenic flights, aerial photography and filming, general charter, news gathering, law enforcement, and wildlife managment.

title: Tecnam Aircraft - Tecnam P.2004 Bravo
desc: The Tecnam P.2004 Bravo is generally used as a light sport aircraft(LSA) for both recreational flying and flight training.

title: Bell Textron - Bell 206B III
desc: The Bell 206B III was generally used for various civilian and commercial roles, including corporate transport, aerial photography, law enforcement, sightseeing tours, emergency medical services (EMS), and utility operations like powerline inspections. Ot was also used for military training.

title: Piper Aircraft - Piper PA-28-161 Warrior II
desc: The Piper PA-28-161 Warrior II is primarily used for flight training, personal use, and air taxi services. Its stable flight characteristics, relatively low operating costs, and forgiving nature make it a popular choice for student pilots and private owners alike.

title: Cessna Aircraft Company - Cessna 150F
desc: The Cessna 150F is primarily used for flight training, touring, and personal use due to its simplicity, reliability, and low operating costs.

title: Robinson Helicopter Company - R44 Raven II
desc: The Robinson R44 is a versatile four-seat helicopter primarily used for pilot training, scenic flights, aerial photography and filming, general charter, news gathering, law enforcement, and wildlife managment.

title: Piper Aircraft - Piper PA-28-161 Warrior II
desc: The Piper PA-28-161 Warrior II is primarily used for flight training, personal use, and air taxi services. Its stable flight characteristics, relatively low operating costs, and forgiving nature make it a popular choice for student pilots and private owners alike.

title: North American Aviation - T-6 Harvard
desc: The T-6 was primarily used as an advanced trainer aircraft for pilots transitioning to fighter and bomber aircraft during World War II and well into the 1950s. It also saw some combat use in vasious conflicts.

title: Antonov Design Bureai of Ukraine - Antonov An-32B
desc: The Antonov An-32B is primarily used as a light military transport aircraft for cargo, passenger, and paradropping, especially in hot or high conditions. It can also be used for medical evacuation and firefighting.

title: Sling Aircraft - Sling 4
desc: The Sling 4 is generally used for as a four-seat light sport aircraft for cross-country touring, personal use, and recreational flying, perticularly appealing to owner-builders due to its kit availability.

title: Robinson Helicopter Company - R44 Astro
desc: The Robinson R44 is a versatile four-seat helicopter primarily used for pilot training, scenic flights, aerial photography and filming, general charter, news gathering, law enforcement, and wildlife managment.

title: Eurocopter AS350 B2 Ecureuil
desc: The Eurocopter AS350 B2 Écureuil, also known as the Squirrel, was a versatile helicopter widely used for various purposes due to its performance, reliability, and adaptability. It was commonly employed in roles such as law enforcement, emergency medical services (EMS), aerial work, and passenger transport.

title: Aérospatiale - SA 315B Lama
desc: The SA 315B Lama was generally used as a light utility helicopter, primariy for operating in hot and high conditions, especially in mountainous regions. Its roles include light passenger and cargo transport, underslung load carrying.(up to 1000kg), search and rescue, medical evacuation, agricultural tasks,oil and gas exploration, and aerial firefighting. It was also used for military liasion, observation, and photography

title: Airbus - A380-861
desc: The A380 is generally used for long-haul international passenger flights due to its large capacity and focus on passenger comfort.

title: The Boeing Company - 787-8 Dreamliner
desc: The Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner is generally used for long-hual, international passenger flights,offering airlines fuel efficiency, passenger comfort, and the ability to open new direct routes.

title: The Boeing Company - 787-800 Dreamliner
desc: The Boeing 787-800 Dreamliner is generally used for long-hual, international passenger flights,offering airlines fuel efficiency, passenger comfort, and the ability to open new direct routes.

title: The Boeing Company - 737-844
desc: The Boeing 737-800 is generally used for short to medium-haul commercial passenger flights by airlines worldwide.

title: The Boeing Company - 737-4S3
desc: The Boeing 737-400 is generally used for short to medium-haul commercial passenger flights, though many have been converted to cargo operations as they are phased out of passenger service.

title: The Boeing Company - 737-8SH
desc: The Boeing 737-800 is generally used for short to medium-haul commercial passenger flights by airlines worldwide.

title: Embraer - ERJ-140LR
desc: The ERJ-140LR is generally used for regional passenger flights by airlines, offering inceased range and capacity compared to smaller regional jets.

title: Embraer - ERJ-145LR
desc: The ERJ-145LR is generally used for regional passenger flights, particularly on routes requiring longer range and higher passenger capacity than smaller regional jets. Its is also utilized for corporate charters and specialized operations due to its comfort and preformance.

title: Embraer - ERJ-190-100IGW
desc: The ERJ-190-100IGW is generally used for short to medium-haul regional passenger flights.

title: Airbus - A320-232
desc: The A320-200 is primarily used for short to medium-haul commercial passenger flights. It is a popular narrow-body aircraft for both low-cost and mainline airlines worldwide.

title: De Havilland Canada - Bombardier Dash 8-Q402
desc: The Dash 8 aircraft is primarily used for regional passenger and cargo transport. Its versatility aslo allows it to be used for firefighting, maritime surveillance, and other special mission roles, especially given its ability to operate from smaller airports and unpaved runways.

title: Pilatus PC-12
desc: The Pilatus PC-12 is a versatile Swiss-built single-engine turboprop aircraft, and it's widely respected for its reliability, range, and performance.

title: Bell Textron - Bell 430
desc: The Bell 43 was an experimental prototype, not a helicopter with general use. It helped advance rotorcraft technology but never entered regular service.

title: Messerschmitt-Bölkow-Blohm - MBB BO 105
desc: The MBB Bo 105 (Messerschmitt-Bölkow-Blohm) is a light, twin-engine utility helicopter that became widely known for its agility, reliability, and versatility. It has been used in civilian, law enforcement, and military roles around the world.

title: Cessna 421C Golden Eagle
desc: The Cessna 421C Golden Eagle is a pressurized, twin-engine piston aircraft designed for high-performance business and personal travel, though it's also used in a range of other utility roles.

title: Bell Textron - Bell 429
desc: The Bell 429 is a twin-engine light utility helicopter, known for its modern avionics, smooth ride, and versatility. It’s used globally in both civilian and public service sectors.

title: N/A
desc: N/A

title: Bell Textron - Bell 407
desc: The Bell 407 is a single-engine, light utility helicopter widely known for its reliability, performance, and versatility. It’s one of Bell’s most successful civilian rotorcraft and is used around the world in a variety of missions.

title: Piper PA-18 Super Cub
desc: The Piper PA-18 Super Cub is a two-seat, single-engine taildragger that's famous for its simplicity, ruggedness, and Short Takeoff and Landing (STOL) capability. It’s one of the most iconic bush planes ever built.

title: Bell Textron - Bell 206
desc: The Bell 206 is one of the most widely used light utility helicopters ever built. It’s a single-engine (JetRanger) or twin-engine (TwinRanger) helicopter, known for its reliability, affordability, and versatility across both civilian and military sectors.

title: Bell Textron - Bell 206 Long Ranger
desc: The Bell 206 LongRanger (also known as the Bell 206L) is a stretched, longer-fuselage variant of the Bell 206 JetRanger, designed to carry more passengers and cargo while retaining the reliability and performance of the original.

title: Bell Textron - Bell 222
desc: The Bell 222 is a twin-engine light helicopter known for its sleek, streamlined design and smooth performance. It was one of the first light twin-engine helicopters aimed squarely at the corporate/VIP market, but it also found roles in EMS and utility missions.

title: Diamond DA-42 Twin Star
desc: The Diamond DA-42 Twin Star is a light, twin-engine piston aircraft primarily designed for training, surveillance, and general utility roles. It’s a modern, fuel-efficient, composite-built plane with advanced avionics.

title: N/A
desc: Known this aircraft?

title: Airbus H125
desc: The Airbus H125 (formerly known as the Eurocopter AS350 Écureuil/Squirrel) is a single-engine, light utility helicopter renowned for its performance, reliability, and versatility.

title: Cessna 172
desc: The Cessna 172 Skyhawk is one of the most popular and widely produced single-engine, four-seat light aircraft in aviation history. It’s known for being simple, reliable, and easy to fly.

title: N/A
desc: Know this aircraft?

title: Bell Textron - Bell 206L-1 LongRanger
desc: The Bell 206L-1 LongRanger is a stretched, single-engine light utility helicopter—an extended version of the Bell 206 JetRanger designed to carry more passengers and cargo with the same reliable performance.

title: Piper Saratoga II HP
desc: The Piper Saratoga II HP is a single-engine, high-performance, six-seat piston aircraft primarily designed for personal, business, and utility flying. It’s known for its comfort, speed, and good range, making it popular among private owners and small businesses.

title: Robinson Helicopter Company - R44 Raven II
desc: The Robinson R44 Raven II is a four-seat, single-engine light helicopter that’s one of the most popular piston helicopters worldwide due to its affordability, simplicity, and reliability.

title: Socata TBM-850
desc: The Socata TBM-850 is a single-engine turboprop high-performance business aircraft known for blending speed, efficiency, and comfort. It’s a popular choice for owner-pilots and small businesses needing fast, cost-effective travel.

title: Cessna 172
desc: The Cessna 172 Skyhawk is one of the most popular and widely produced single-engine, four-seat light aircraft in aviation history. It’s known for being simple, reliable, and easy to fly.

title: Airbus A220-300 (BCS3)
desc: The Airbus A220-300 is a narrow-body, twin-engine jet airliner designed for short- to medium-haul commercial passenger service. It’s known for its fuel efficiency, modern design, and passenger comfort.

title: Embraer - E195AR
desc: The Embraer E195AR (where AR stands for “Advanced Range”) is a regional jet airliner designed for short- to medium-haul commercial passenger service with extended range capabilities.

title: Boeing 737-8BG
desc: The Boeing 737-8BG is a specific variant of the Boeing 737 MAX 8 series, manufactured by Boeing and delivered to certain airlines (the “BG” suffix is a customer code, typically for Southwest Airlines). It’s a narrow-body, twin-engine jet airliner widely used for short- to medium-haul commercial passenger flights.

title: Boeing 737-8HX
desc: The Boeing 737-8HX is a specific customer-coded variant of the Boeing 737 MAX 8, with “HX” being the customer code (commonly assigned to Hainan Airlines). It’s a narrow-body, twin-engine jet airliner widely used for commercial passenger flights.

title: Boeing 777-FFX
desc: The Boeing 777-F (also known as the 777 Freighter) is the cargo (freight) version of the Boeing 777 family, designed specifically for long-haul, heavy cargo transport.

title: Airbus A350-941
desc: The Airbus A350-941 is a specific variant of the A350 XWB (Extra Wide Body) family, designed for long-haul, widebody commercial passenger service.

title: Airbus A330-243F
desc: The Airbus A330-243F is a freighter (cargo) variant of the Airbus A330 family, designed specifically for medium- to long-haul air cargo transport.

title: Airbus A320-232
desc: The Airbus A320-232 is a narrow-body commercial jet primarily used for short- to medium-haul passenger flights.

title: Embraer - ERJ-145LR
desc: The Embraer ERJ-145LR is generally used for regional passenger transport.

title: Airbus A380-861
desc: The Airbus A380-861 is generally used for long-haul, high-capacity international passenger transport.

title: Airbus A380-842
desc: The Airbus A380-842 is generally used for long-haul, high-capacity international passenger transport.

title: Airbus A320-231
desc: The Airbus A320-231 is a narrow-body commercial jet primarily used for short- to medium-haul passenger flights.

title: Embraer - ERJ-135LR
desc: The Embraer ERJ-135LR is a versatile regional jet, mainly used for short-haul commercial flights, corporate travel, and government transport, offering reliable performance and access to smaller airports.

title: Boeing 737-8EH
desc: The 737-8EH is a workhorse narrow-body jet, ideal for low-cost carriers and regional airlines operating short to medium distances with high passenger volume. It’s essentially a 737-800 tailored to a specific airline’s needs.

title: De Havilland Canada Dash 8-100
desc: The Dash 8-100 is a rugged, reliable turboprop built to handle challenging conditions, making it ideal for rural routes, island-hopping, and cold-weather operations — especially in places like Canada, Alaska, Africa, and the Pacific Islands.

title: Embraer - EMB-120ER Brasilia
desc: The EMB-120ER Brasilia is a tough, fast, and efficient regional turboprop that was a popular workhorse in the 1980s–2000s. While it’s less common today, it still flies in niche markets, especially in developing regions or areas with short runways and limited infrastructure.

title: Airbus A320-232
desc: The A320-232 is a workhorse for airlines, mainly used for domestic and regional commercial passenger service due to its efficiency, size, and reliability.

title: Embraer - E170LR
desc: The E170LR is a modern, fuel-efficient regional jet ideal for airlines serving medium-density routes where a larger jet isn't practical. It’s valued for its jet performance, passenger comfort, and ability to operate from smaller airports with short runways or limited infrastructure.
